[[Morgoth]] | language= | birth=''Possibly'' {{FA|428}}[[Ulfast#Ulfast's year of birth|NB]] | birthlocation=East of [[Ered Luin]] | rule= | death={{FA|472}} | deathlocation=[[Nirnaeth Arnoediad]] | age=44 | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Ulfang]] | siblings=[[Uldor]] & [[Ulwarth]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Ulfast''' was the second son[[Ulfast#Ulfast's year of birth|NB]] of [[Ulfang]] the ''Black''. == History == After entering [[Beleriand]], Ulfast along with his father and his brothers joined the service of [[Caranthir]].{{S|18}} Ultimately though, his father Ulfang's purpose from the beginning was to eventually betray the [[Elves]],{{GA|174}}, pp. 60-1, ''footnote'' which he and his brothers ultimately did in the [[Battle of Unnumbered Tears]], under the leadership of [[Uldor]] the Accursed - they turned against their allies, attacking them in the rear. Their betrayal proved crucial in the fight against Morgoth's forces, though, and Morgoth was victorious. However, Ulfast, as well as his brother [[Ulwarth]] were killed by the sons of [[Bór]], who remained loyal to the sons of [[Fëanor]] during the battle - while Ulfast's brother Uldor was slain by [[Maglor]].{{S|20}} == Genealogy[[Ulfast#Ulfast's year of birth|NB]] == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree| | | | | ULG | | | | |ULG=[[Ulfang]]

''{{FA|430}} - {{FA|472|n}}''}} {{familytree/end}} == Etymology == The name ''Ulfast'' was probably not the character's true name, as it seems to be [[Sindarin]] for "Ugly shaggy hair": ''[[ul-]]'' ("ugly") + ''[[fast]]'' ("shaggy hair").{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-827428763.html|articlename=S. ''Ulfast'' m.|dated=|website=Eldamo|accessed=21 August 2023}}While ''[[Eldamo]]'' considers the name ''Ulfast'' to be Sindarin, its constituent parts are actually in [[Noldorin]] (which was a precursor language to Sindarin). A curious thing about the name ''Ulfast'' is that it remained unchanged from its conception to the later [[legendarium]]. == Other versions of the legendarium == === Earlier versions of the ''[[Nirnaeth]]'' === According to an earlier version of the legendarium, instead of being killed by the sons of [[Bór]], both Ulfast and his brother Ulwar survived the Battle of Unnumbered Tears - in fact, they were the ones that slew Bor and his sons in battle.{{LR|AB}}, entry '''272''', p. 137 However, even though Morgoth pledged better lands to Ulfang, Ulfast's father, he ultimately reneged on his promise and exiled the remainder of his people (under the leadership of Ulfast and Ulwar) to [[Hithlum]], which was an unfertile and desolate land; Morgoth also forbade them from ever journeying to other lands. Afterwards, the folk of Ulfast and Ulwar brutally oppressed the remaining native folk of [[House of Hador|Hádor]] who were already living there before their arrival.{{LR|AB}}, entry '''273''', p. 138 === Ulfast's year of birth === In the appendix of ''[[The Lost Road and Other Writings]]'' in ''[[The Genealogies]]'' (dating from the early [[1930]]s), it is stated that Ulfast was born in the year 128.{{LR|A1}}, p. 403 When comparing the above date with its associated text ''[[The Earliest Annals of Beleriand]]'', Ulfast was born 35 years before the [[Swarthy Men]] entered Beleriand in the year 163.{{SM|7I}}, entry '''year 163''', p. 300 Also, the dates found in ''The Earliest Annals of Beleriand'' were by and large moved 300 years into the future in ''[[The Grey Annals]]'' (c. early [[1950]]s), such that, for example, an event happening in the year 195 in ''The Earliest Annals'' now happened in the year {{FA|495|n}}.{{SM|7Ic}}, ''Annals 155 to 157'', pp. 319-20 {{references|notes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ulfast}} [[Category:Characters in The Silmarillion]] [[Category:Easterlings (First Age)]] [[Category:First Age characters]] [[Category:Noldorin names]] [[Category:Servants of Melkor]] [[Category:Sindarin names]] [[de:Ulfast]] [[fi:Ulfast]] [[fr:encyclo/personnages/hommes/1a/orientaux/ulfast]]
